Operation 'CreateMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create List' is too generic and lacks domain context. Description mentions automation UI but lacks clarity on required inputs, response structure, and how to populate the list. Enhanced version specifies this creates a 'static contacts list', clarifies input requirements, explains the response structure, and provides context about next steps (adding contacts via Contacts API).

data.current_description:
**This endpoint creates a new contacts list.**

Once you create a list, you can use the UI to [trigger an automation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/getting-started-with-automation/#create-an-automation) every time you add a new contact to the list.

A link to the newly created object is in `_metadata`.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new marketing contacts list
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new static contacts list for Marketing Campaigns. The request body should include the list name and optional description. Returns the newly created list object with a 201 status code. The list URL is provided in the `_metadata` field. Once created, you can add contacts to this list using the Contacts API or trigger automations when new contacts are added.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create List' is too generic and lacks domain context. Description mentions automation UI but lacks clarity on required inputs, response structure, and how to populate the list. Enhanced version specifies this creates a 'static contacts list', clarifies input requirements, explains the response structure, and provides context about next steps (adding contacts via Contacts API).

message: Operation 'ListMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary lacks domain specificity and action clarity. Description is too minimal - doesn't mention pagination support, response structure, or use cases. Enhanced version adds domain context ('Marketing Campaigns account'), clarifies pagination capability, describes response structure, and provides context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint returns an array of all of your contact lists.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an array of all contact lists in your Marketing Campaigns account. Supports pagination through optional parameters. Returns a list of list objects, each containing metadata such as list ID, name, creation date, and contact count. Use this operation to discover available lists before adding or managing contacts.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks domain specificity and action clarity. Description is too minimal - doesn't mention pagination support, response structure, or use cases. Enhanced version adds domain context ('Marketing Campaigns account'), clarifies pagination capability, describes response structure, and provides context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. Description is incomplete - it only mentions updating the name but doesn't clarify what inputs are required, what the response contains, or that this is a partial update operation. Enhanced version specifies the required path parameter, request body structure, clarifies partial update behavior, and describes the response to help AI agents understand the operation's full scope.

data.current_description: **This endpoint updates the name of a list.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of a specific marketing contacts list. Requires the list ID in the path and a request body containing the new list name. Supports partial updates - only the name field will be modified. Returns the updated list object with a 200 status code. Other list properties remain unchanged.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description is incomplete - it only mentions updating the name but doesn't clarify what inputs are required, what the response contains, or that this is a partial update operation. Enhanced version specifies the required path parameter, request body structure, clarifies partial update behavior, and describes the response to help AI agents understand the operation's full scope.

message: Operation 'DeleteMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is acceptable but description has clarity issues. Original description has a typo ('deletes' should be 'delete') and lacks important details about default behavior, response codes, and asynchronous processing. Enhanced version clarifies the default behavior (list deleted, contacts retained), explains the optional parameter's effect, specifies both possible response codes, and emphasizes the permanent nature of the operation for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to deletes a specific list.**

Optionally, you can also delete contacts associated to the list. The query parameter, `delete_contacts=true`, will delete the list and start an asynchronous job to delete associated contacts.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific marketing contacts list by ID. By default, only the list is deleted and associated contacts remain in your account. To also delete all contacts associated with the list, set the optional query parameter `delete_contacts=true`, which initiates an asynchronous deletion job. Returns a 204 status code on success or 200 if contacts deletion was initiated. This operation permanently removes the list and optionally its contacts.
data.reasoning: Summary is acceptable but description has clarity issues. Original description has a typo ('deletes' should be 'delete') and lacks important details about default behavior, response codes, and asynchronous processing. Enhanced version clarifies the default behavior (list deleted, contacts retained), explains the optional parameter's effect, specifies both possible response codes, and emphasizes the permanent nature of the operation for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DeleteContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary lacks domain specificity. Description doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove, what the request body should contain, or clarify the asynchronous nature (202 response). Enhanced version specifies the required path parameter, explains request body structure, clarifies the distinction between list removal and contact deletion, and explains the 202 response code for better AI agent understanding of operation timing.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove contacts from a given list.**

The contacts will not be deleted. Only their list membership will be changed.
data.summary_suggestion: Remove contacts from a marketing list
data.description_suggestion: Removes one or more contacts from a specific marketing contacts list. The list ID is provided in the path. The request body should contain the contact identifiers (email addresses or contact IDs) to remove. Contacts are not deleted from your account - only their membership in this list is removed. They remain available in other lists and in your overall contacts database. Returns a 202 status code indicating the removal request has been accepted for asynchronous processing.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks domain specificity. Description doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove, what the request body should contain, or clarify the asynchronous nature (202 response). Enhanced version specifies the required path parameter, explains request body structure, clarifies the distinction between list removal and contact deletion, and explains the 202 response code for better AI agent understanding of operation timing.
